snippet: The report accused the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives officials of management failures in the gun-trafficking inquiry called Operation Fast and Furious.
abstract: Republican Congressional investigators accuse five supervisors at the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives of management failures in the disputed Arizona-based gun-trafficking investigation called Operation Fast and Furious.
lead_paragraph: The report accused the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives officials of management failures in the gun-trafficking inquiry called Operation Fast and Furious.

headline.seo: 5 A.T.F. Officials in Operation Fast and Furious Faulted in Report
headline.main: Report Criticizes A.T.F. Supervisors in Gun Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Report Criticizes A.T.F. Supervisors in Gun Inquiry
